results.title: Air at work
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, Michael Latham and Christopher Haws
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
This program presents experiments that demonstrate the varying forces that are created when air moves. Demonstrates the theory of flight and the creation of weather patterns.

results.title: Air all around us
results.brief_description: This film is designed to implement the study of air by developing the following concepts: air is all around us; air is a substance, ie it occupies space, and can be weighed; air exerts pressure from all sides; air expands when it is heated and contracts when it is cooled; air can be compressed.

results.title: Aimee & Jaguar = Aimee and Jaguar
results.creator_credit: Senator Film Production, Hanno Huth, Gunter Rohrbach and Max Farberbock
results.brief_description: Based on the memoirs of Lilly Wust as recorded by Erica Fischer in her best-selling book, published in 1994, “Aimee and Jaguar” is a compelling love story that transgresses socially and politically imposed regulations around gender, race and culture. It tells the true story of two German women, one Jewish and one Aryan, who dared to fall deeply in love with each other at the height of the Holocaust. 1943- Lilly is a model bourgeois German mother of four children who indulges in affairs while husband is away fighting on the Eastern front. When she receives a love letter signed ‘Jaguar,’ she suspects a male admirer. But it is from the audacious Felice, a Jewish Resistance fighter, who initiates the passionate love affair that ignites between the two women amidst the bombing raids and anti-Semitic persecution. Inevitably it is a romance that is destined to end in tragedy. An immensely moving period drama, that also offers a visually impressive evocation of life in Berlin during WWII. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Aids: what everyone needs to know [Revised] (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An authoritative exploration of AIDS produced in cooperation with the UCLA AIDS Centre. Discusses symptoms, transmission, diagnosis, how the body becomes prone to other diseases and the increasing danger to the general population. A family in which the husband has AIDS share their feelings.

results.title: Aids: not adults only
results.creator_credit: Musical Films, Cristina Pozzan and Ray Argall
results.brief_description: Four teenagers explore issues surrounding AIDS in frank and informative interviews with counsellors, other teenagers and a 19 year old who contracted the virus. Discusses how AIDS affects the current generation and challenges common misconceptions about the disease. The theme is prevention while simultaneously providing an opportunity for adolescents to review their attitudes and behaviour.

results.title: Aids to independence
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Vintage Years”.
Outlines how elderly people can be assisted to live independently and the contribution of voluntary agencies in providing meeting places. Lord Morrison of Lambeth, a pioneer of municipal government discusses the role of the community and the program concludes with an extract from an interview with the famous psychoanalyst Professor Carl Jung when he was 85.

results.title: AIDS
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Joanne Parrent
results.brief_description: A broad approach that deals with the nature of AIDS, the means of infection, symptoms, prevention, advice and personal responsibilities in relationships. The comprehensive information involves no sexually explicit material and as such is particularly suitable as an introduction to the topic.
